entry.title: Configuring SAP Business Workflow for parked documents (FIPP)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

during a SAP S/4HANA implementation, we have the requirement for parked document approvals via SAP Business Workflow (object type FIPP). As I am new to this topic, I need advice on the following issue:

So far, I did the configuration in customizing under ‚ÄòMake and Check Settings for Document Parking‚Äô, I created the workflow variant, assigned company code and defined release approval paths and procedures for parking documents including mentioning needed subworkflow WS51000020 (FIPP_SUBWFN2, two step approval except initiator). Also, I defined users for release authorizations for each approval level in OBWF. Beforehand, I activated the type linkage in transaction SWE2 for workflow framework WS00400032 for event CREATED as well as event linking in transaction OOCU is activated.

When I create a document with transaction FB01 and save it as completed, I check afterward in FBV3 and see the document is not released as expected. When I check workflow -> workflow overview, I see that workflow is not going through as expected. In display workflow log, I check the error message in work item and it says error in workflow customizing for document parking in OBWE. I checked the transaction and related customizing, but I am unable to find the hidden mistake.

Does anyone have an advice on how to solve this issue? Is this anything else to consider?

Thank you in advance for any advice on this matter

Kind regards

Jonas

entry.title: Instance Refresh Tool and New Learning Experience in SuccessFactors LMS
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are planning an instance refresh for our SuccessFactors Learning (LMS) development and QA environments and have a few questions related to the process and the New Learning Experience:

  1. Is a customer with VSaaS LMS eligible to use the Instance Refresh Tool (IRT)?
  2. If eligible, can the tool be used for both BizX and LMS instances?
  3. During the instance refresh (manual or via IRT), will the new custom contents (such as custom cards, pages, and banners) that are part of the New Learning Experience in the source system replace those in the target system?
  4. Will the email notification templates in the source instance overwrite those in the target instance?
  5. Any additional information or best practices related to the New Learning Experience and instance refresh would be greatly appreciated.

Looking forward to your insights and experiences!

entry.title: SAP TRM Daily Compounding Interest Calculation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to use SAP TRM on public cloud to calculate daily compounding interest in the same way as my Excel model. In Excel, each day‚Äôs interest is calculated on the sum of the original principal plus all previously accrued (unpaid) interest, so the interest compounds daily. However, in SAP, I am getting different results‚ÄîSAP seems to be calculating interest only on the original principal, not including the previous day‚Äôs accrued interest in the base.

Excel Calculation Logic:

  • Each day‚Äôs interest base: Principal + Previous Day‚Äôs Cumulative Interest
  • Formula: Base Interest = (Principal + Previous Day‚Äôs Int Cmpd Bal) √ó Rate √ó Days / 360
  • This means the interest compounds daily, and the interest amount grows slightly each day as it is calculated on a growing balance

Difference in SAP currently: Each day‚Äôs interest = Principal √ó Rate / 360 (Previous interest is not included in the base)

I want SAP to calculate daily interest so that each day‚Äôs interest is based on the sum of the principal plus all previously accrued interest (i.e., true daily compounding), matching my Excel model. The goal is for SAP to use the previous day‚Äôs cumulative balance as the new base for interest calculation.

  • Is there a way to configure SAP so that it compounds interest daily, using the previous day‚Äôs cumulative balance as the new base for interest calculation?
  • Are there specific settings, calculation methods, or configuration steps in SAP that need to be enabled or adjusted to achieve this?
  • Has anyone successfully set up daily compounding interest in SAP to match this Excel logic? If so, could you share the configuration steps or any tips?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: MRP Planning Issue
entry.content:
Hello

 

Why do you need to have MRP type ND your finished product? Components will only be planned if you have dependent requirements and dependent requirements will only be created if you have a planned order for the finished product, so it does not really make sense to use ND.

Regards,
Caetano

entry.title: Re: ABAP RAP - Enable/Disable Static Action on Child enti...
entry.content:
@Praveen547 

1. You can use the Feature Control to enable the button when the entity is in draft status (using the %is_draft field).

METHOD get_instance_features.
  LOOP AT keys INTO DATA(ls_key).
    IF ls_key-%is_draft = if_abap_behv=>mk-on.
      "enable the action
    ELSE.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

2.  You can set SideEffects annotations for unbound actions in the annotations.xml file.

Please see the section Defining Side Effects on Unbound Actions in the document below:

https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/sdk/#/topic/18b17bdd49d1436fa9172cbb01e26544

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Manual restriction of Transport import
entry.content:
Hi,

If the TR is managed by ChaRM document, then by default, it can only be imported via ChaRM. We have a project switch concept to control if the TR could be manually imported via STMS or not. Refer to KBA: 0002211597 for more details of the CTS project switch. This switch is closed for all systems by default when you create task list for the cycle.

BR

entry.title: Re: Payguide(salary ranges) are getting adjusted on the b...
entry.content:
Hi @Ritanshi9 ,

My understanding is that for this tag, it is expected that since it is set to false it is removed from the xml.  The behaviour of the template should still follow a false flag.  Please advise if you are seeing different behaviour.

Another option to explore is the use of a custom FTE field to display true FTE but setting the standard field to 1 (which is default if not used).  This blog and associated comments/questions is extremely thorough, so I suggest you review if you haven't already FTE and Proration examples in Compensation - SAP Community

Hope that helps.

Christian

entry.title: Re: Building Joule Skills for Sales Order Queries in S/4HANA Cloud - Part 1: Environment Setup
entry.content:
@BharathKumarVaddepalli 

Hi Bharath,

You should configure the destination in your BTP cockpit first using the Sales Order OData V4 API:
üëâ SAP API Business Hub ‚Äì CE_SALESORDER_0001

Scroll down to API Resources, where you‚Äôll find the configuration details for the production URL. Use that as your System URI in the destination settings.
Once the destination is successfully created and tested, you can reference it directly in your Joule action project ‚Äî no need to include the full API path inside the destination.

Hope this clarifies it!

‚Äî Teng Teng

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: SAP TechEd in Berlin special edition!
entry.content:
Last week happened one of the biggest highlights of the year for our SAP community! The SAP TechEd in Berlin was an incredible opportunity to bring together Developers, SAP Mentors and Champions, experts, and community members from all over the world for an inspiring few days filled with innovation, learning, and sharing. From the main keynote announcements to hands-on sessions and vibrant community meetups, SAP TechEd in Berlin 2025 was a true celebration of connections and technology.

Whether you joined us on-site or virtually, there were so many great announcements to take in from exciting updates in ABAP and AI, to the amazing energy of the SAP Community Clubhouse. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at some of the best moments and highlights!

Blog Posts about SAP TechEd in Berlin

SAP HANA Cloud goes agentic! 

SAP HANA Cloud is our cloud-native database as a service, delivering in-memory performance, multi-model data processing capabilities and elastic scale for intelligent applications. And to make these capabilities even more accessible and enable full power of the system, in early 2026, due to two new agents: the Discovery Agent and the Data Agent. The Discovery Agent is your companion to find and identify relevant tables, views, columns, and user-defined functions for any business case. The Data Agent converts natural-language intent into executable queries (e.g., SQL) to retrieve your data of interest. For this to be possible, SAP is expanding the SAP HANA Cloud knowledge graph engine with the ability to generate custom database-objects. Agents and the built-in knowledge graph help developers and business users find the right data through context and relationships. To understand more, SAP¬¥s Thomas Hammer and ‚ÄØShabana Samsudheen prepared two great blog posts with details about fully Agentic Multi-Model database.  

Read Thomas blog post here  

Read Shabana blog post here 

Paradigm Shift for Enterprise AI 

One of the biggest announcements at SAP TechEd in Berlin, was the launch of SAP table-native foundation model, pre-trained to understand your table-based business data out-of-the-box across a vast range of predictive tasks, without the need for task-specific training or fine-tuning. Until now, most organizations were using different AI specialist models for each prediction task, what makes the AI landscape slower. The launch of sap-rpt-1 (rpt stands for Relational Pretrained Transformer), it is designed to be a single universal AI engine table-native, for SAP¬¥s customers and partners. The best part is the in-context learning capability, which means that sap-rpt-1 doesn¬¥t require task-specific training, just need to receive labeled table row examples of your predictive task‚ÄØin-context, and the model delivers a highly accurate prediction. This engine was developed by our AI researchers (recently‚ÄØpublished‚ÄØto this year‚Äôs NeurIPS conference) and they made sure to bring more details on a blog post for our SAP Community. We highly recommend taking a good look and learning how to start using the preview version. 

Read Philipp Herzig blog post here 

Key Innovations for the ABAP Cloud development  

At SAP TechEd in Berlin, one of the main spotlights was the announcements that redefine the ABAP Cloud development experience. The big 4 key innovations are: ABAP entering the era of Agentic AI, ABAP LLMs available on GenAI Hub, ABAP AI capabilities will be supported in earlier releases, and ABAP is embracing an open IDE strategy with VS Code (Visual Studio Code). These advancements mark a milestone in the continuous work of unlocking intelligent automation, more productivity, and smarter enterprise solutions. SAP¬¥s Sonja Lienard, published a full blog post with all the main details. If you have always been an ABAP fan and have been looking for a more modern experience, this is a must read!

Read Sonja Lienard blog post here 

SAP Community Clubhouse highlights 

For our SAP community, SAP TechEd in Berlin meant more than learning and developing skills, it was also an amazing opportunity to experience real-life connections with people who have been connected online for so many years. Inside the SAP Community, all members get to experience the feeling of being supported and offering help, while gaining valuable insights just through sharing and exchanging blog posts, forums, groups, and much more. At the SAP Community Clubhouse, all this experience was reflected in the interactions, presentations, and small chats. Our team is incredibly happy and grateful to everyone who could join. We know that being present at events like this can take a lot of work, and we highly appreciate everyone‚Äôs effort in participating and bringing so much positive energy. 

SAP Mentor Bj√∂rn Schulz wrote an amazing recap (read the full blog post here) and shared some of his favorite parts of his first time at SAP TechEd. Check out some of his highlights: 

  • The Developer Keynote creatively showcased teamwork across technologies like HANA Cloud, AI, and Process Automation, embracing real-world ‚Äúdeveloper mistakes‚Äù that made it relatable. 
  • The Joule LLM for ABAP Developers promises smarter, context-aware coding support within the Business Technology Platform. 
  • Despite logistical hiccups, SAP TechEd 2025 offered valuable learning, networking, and a glimpse into the next era of ABAP and AI integration. The community spirit and new developer tools made it a rewarding experience. 

SAP Community news 

Updates for a better experience

Our SAP Community platform has gained some great new features over the past two weeks! We know how important it is for everyone to always have the best navigation experience possible, and these updates were designed to make connecting, sharing, and discovering content even easier. The main changes are:  

  • Filter My Content by Interaction Style: Allows to filter the My Content Page by distinct types of interaction (e.g., Answers and Replies), which makes it easier to find posts you have created. 
  • SAP Managed Tag Page: Now the width of the page has been extended to give a better overview of the list. 
  • TKB Documents: The last edited date has been added to TKB Documents, so now members can be more certain about when the information has been published and is still relatable.  

Got a minute? Tell us what you think!

We‚Äôd appreciate if you could take part in this short survey about SAP Community. By answering these 6 questions, you‚Äôre helping the community a lot! Access the survey link here

entry.title: Re: We want to rename an existing SAP service accounts (...
entry.content:
Please refer to KBA 2832479 - How to change the "display name" of a cloud system - SAP for Me

Abstract IMPORTANT INFORMATION for your reference:

  • Using this process to change the System Name only changes the display name in SAP for Me, not the permanent/default system name.
    There is no impact to any other connected system and access to the tenants if the system name/description is changed.
    • Since many cloud systems use the same generic name by default, it is hard to tell them apart when creating a case in SAP for Me. To help distinguish the various cloud tenants, customers can change the display name for cloud systems in SAP for Me by following the steps below.
  • The "System Name SAP Default" is the original/default tenant name and cannot be changed in SAP for Me. For this type of change, you must contact your SAP Account Manager and/or Implementation Partner directly as mentioned in KBA 2607673.
  • This self-service enables you to change the cloud system name and ID. SAP cloud systems are all systems that are managed by SAP Cloud Operation teams. This includes SAP Cloud Platform services, SAP Business By Design tenants, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Systems, SAP SuccessFactors instances, Concur services.
    Note: systems operated in the SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud systems (HEC) or Business Technology Platform (BTP) cannot be renamed with this service request. The names of HEC systems can be specified by SAP customer already before provisioning. The names of BTP systems can be changed directly in BTP by changing the corresponding display names, for example of Global Account, Subaccount, Space, or ServiceInstance.

entry.title: Re: UFL 'u212com.dll' that implements this function is mi...
entry.content:
Hello,

That error indicates CR is looking for possibly a 32 bit UFL, that file is the new UFL interface. If you write one in the proper format it will show up under the Formula Editor:

Microsoft said they were dropping COM years ago and had plan to replace it with .NET Framework, too many developers complained so they kept COM. At the time CR created the .NET components and committed and therefore dropped COM as well, the old RDC engine.

I doubt they are dropping it completely, CR still uses COM dll's and not likely able to drop it.... But I'm retired now so I don't know what SAP plans on doing with that kind of info...

A quick google search found this:

Microsoft is

not dropping support for COM DLLs. The Component Object Model (COM) and its associated Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs) are fundamental components of the Windows operating system and are deeply integrated into many core features and applications. 

 
While Microsoft's focus has shifted towards newer technologies like the .NET framework for modern development, COM remains an essential part of maintaining backward compatibility and functionality within the Windows ecosystem. 
 
Key points:
 
  • Continued Importance: Many critical Windows functions, including ActiveX and OLE, rely heavily on COM.
  • Backward Compatibility: Removing support for COM would break an immense number of existing applications and software that rely on these components, which Microsoft aims to avoid.
  • Modern Alternatives: Microsoft encourages developers to use modern application development frameworks such as .NET moving forward, as they are considered superior to COM interfaces for many new projects.
  • Security: Microsoft has released guidance on securely loading libraries to prevent DLL-related attacks (like DLL hijacking), but this is a security measure, not an attempt to drop the technology itself. 
  •  
If you are experiencing issues with COM DLLs, they are likely related to specific program installations, system file corruption, or security settings, and can usually be resolved through standard troubleshooting steps like reinstalling the program or running system file checks. 

Anyways, have a look at the .NET UFL KBA to replace your existing UFL:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/1603381

You can change the UFL platform in Options:

Also be aware at the end of this year, 2025, SAP is dropping 32 bit CR .NET runtime, Note CR 2025 is a 64 bit application. You will need to develop your existing UFL for 64 bit Platform, or both if you plan to still support older CR 32 bit.

ALSO, CR dropped TTX support years ago, it's time to move to a different database. Note you can still use it in CR 2025 but highly recommend migrating to a SQL based data source.

Ido may have a solution for you to convert to a new data source...

entry.title: Unlocking the NPP: SAP Capabilities for Faster, Smarter Payments
entry.content:
The payments landscape is rapidly changing and in Australia the New Payments Platform ("NPP") is providing new infrastructure and capabilities.

Our customers want to understand more about what the NPP offers and how SAP is enabling the adoption of the new innovations, as well as the implications for data and payment processes.

This Blog series is the result of close collaboration between SAP and the Australian Payments Plus team, who are responsible for the NPP. It is a combined effort with the SAP ANZ localization team, notably my colleague @Bino_Philip  who has done much of the heavy lifting in defining the SAP response. Any errors are mine alone.

This is an evolving topic and whilst we‚Äôll try to keep it current, please ensure you check the latest SAP documentation. Also bear in mind that until we publish a Development Roadmap, any comments on plans, intentions or other forward looking statements are personal views and not the official SAP position.

The series is planned as:

  1. Unlocking the NPP: SAP Capabilities for Faster, Smarter Payments
  2. Unlocking the NPP: Payments overview
  3. Unlocking the NPP: PayID
  4. Unlocking the NPP: PayTo

 

When will SAP be NPP ready?

This is the number one question we get on this topic, with a mass of confusion on the changes required for NPP and opportunities it presents.

The simple answer is that SAP is already NPP capable with many customers benefiting from real time payments and the additional capabilities available now.

However, to understand the full picture of what is available in SAP across the range of NPP capabilities, how we are delivering innovation and plans for the future, please read on.

 

So what is the NPP?

The New Payments Platform is:

  • Infrastructure which enables real time payments across Australia
  • Additional capabilities to improve security and simplify payments
  • Operated by Australian Payments Plus, whose members include the largest Banks, payment processors and businesses in Australia
  • The eventual replacement for the Bulk Electronic Clearing System (‚ÄúBECS‚Äù) overseen by the Reserve Bank of Australia which will be decommissioned by June 2030

There is a mass of additional information at https://www.auspayplus.com.au/, including technical documentation and file mapping guidance.

The NPP is particularly relevant for payments where Payer and Payee use different Banks and the funds need to be transferred between them, for example from a Westpac account to an NAB account. The current BECS cross bank clearing is a periodic batch process on business days only whereas NPP is a real-time process available 24/7.

The NPP is already available and is being widely used for personal banking. NPP is the technology behind the Osko brand which enables real time payments using the PayID function, removing the need to share Bank details (BSB and Account number).

Note that NPP is currently only relevant to payments within Australia where the Sending and Receiving Banks and other Financial Institutions are connected to the NPP. They can connect directly as an ‚ÄúNPP Participants‚Äù which requires them to meet strict criteria and is largely limited to major Financial Institutions. Other entities who wish to provide NPP services (‚ÄúIdentified Institutions‚Äù) cannot connect directly and must have an agreement with a sponsoring NPP Participant. Where the Payer and Payee use the same Bank, the additional capabilities of NPP such as PayID, PayTo (see below) are still relevant, even though clearing of payments is handled within the Bank.

 

Architecture

Individuals and Corporates will continue to transact though their Bank which for simplicity we will assume is connected directly to the NPP as a ‚ÄúParticipant‚Äù.

 

 

The role of SAP does not change: it will create the payment instructions, receive status updates and bank statements and enable the Bank integration. Additional message types such as for intraday bank statements and APIs may also be relevant.

We do not currently envisage any requirement for SAP systems to connect directly to the NPP.

 

NPP capabilities

The NPP is not just a change in technology or a new platform. It is designed and built to deliver significant business benefits and opportunities to innovate new business models. By sending payments using the NPP, SAP customers can start to leverage these current capabilities and investigate the benefits and opportunities they provide:

  • Real time payment clearing. This means that funds reach the payee in seconds not hours or days, improving cash flow. This has benefits in scenarios such as Public Sector benefits payments where recipients may have an urgent need, for example Bush fire related Disaster Recovery Payments. Similarly real time payments and their related status messages enable immediate execution of follow-on processes such as order credit unblock, sales order processing or delivery release with confidence that the funds have transferred.
  • Real time payment status messages. This means errors can be corrected faster and more payments reach the Payee on time.
  • 24/7 operations, 365 days a year. This provides additional flexibility in payment processing, from processing urgent payments to making payments precisely on the due date, even where this falls on a public holiday. It also assists with meeting compliance obligations, especially around payroll and superannuation.
  • PayID enables payments to be made using the Payee‚Äôs email, phone number, ABN or other identifier, without requiring their BSB and Bank Account details
  • PayTo agreements provide a greater degree of control and transparency for Direct Debit arrangements. The agreement or mandate is stored within the NPP and the Payer can approve, vary, end and define conditions (such as maximum amounts). The Payee needs to quote the agreement number rather than the BSB and Bank Account in the Direct Debit payment file.
  • Confirmation of Payee. This service reduces fraud by checking the name on the Bank Account with the name of the intended Payee recipient.

 

NPP payment files

We will go into more detail in the next Blog on the requirements around making a payment using NPP. The main point to be aware of is that whilst the NPP has specific requirements for payment file format and field mapping, the Bank determines what is required from SAP.

Each Bank will provide documentation on:

  • Payment file format - this is usually based on ISO20022 standard
  • NPP relevant fields, i.e. what is required to ensure processing by NPP rather than BECS

Once the file is created with the required format and fields, it can be sent to the Bank for processing using standard integration. We‚Äôll discuss integration impacts and the challenge for SAP to create a standard NPP compliant solution in the next Blog. 

 

SAP Approach for NPP

Whilst the official SAP Roadmap is still being developed internally, our general approach can be understood as:

  • SAP solutions will be developed and delivered incrementally over future years, rather than as a single release.
  • SAP solutions will be based around a single common standard, such as the ISO standard format and not numerous variations such as for Bank specific formats.
  • SAP will focus on solutions for S/4HANA Cloud, both Public and Private Editions.

entry.title: Transparent Table Comparison
entry.content:
Table Comparison in DTV 1.7

With the newest release of the Data Transition Validation tool, DTV 1.7, transparent tables can now be validated. The tool has been enhanced to support the validation of both standard and custom transparent tables.

This recent feature expands the tool's validation capabilities, enabling it to support validation for 

  • SAP Reports and transactions (70+)
  • Custom reports of ALV output type
  • Custom namespace reports of ALV output type
  • Standard and custom transparent tables

This blog will demonstrate how you can utilize this new feature to compare transparent tables and view the validation results.

Table comparison

Click on ‚ÄúDefine Test Specification‚Äù of the DTV project.

And then click on ‚ÄúTable‚Äù.

Click on Insert Row

Provide the table information as below

  • Transparent table name
  • Description
  • Functional Area
  • Functional Group

You can add multiple tables here.

You can use the Variant if you have any, and/or also provide split and condition parameter as per the requirement.

You can then perform Simulation (Not mandatory) and extract the result in the source system.

Once source extraction is done, similar process can be followed to extract the data in the target system.

Note: Use ‚ÄúImport Simulation Results‚Äù functionality to reuse the extraction result in ‚ÄúData Extraction‚Äù step.

Once extraction is complete for both source and target systems, Data Evaluation can be triggered by selecting the tables and clicking on ‚ÄúRun Selected‚Äù

You can then check the evaluation result in the result tab.

Conclusion

With the addition of the table comparison feature, the scope of DTV validation has significantly broadened, making it more valuable in transition scenarios.

entry.title: SAP RE-FX Reversal process of Asset Retirement
entry.content:
Dear Gurus,

Please assist me on the reversal of an ROU asset retirement from a terminated contract.
Our scenario is as follows:

1. The IFRS16 lease contract was created and given notice June 30, 2025
2. Time slice was created for valuation (termination date +1 day) and proceeded with generation of cashflow as follows:
asset adjustment, depreciation and all postings ended as of June 29, 2025.
3. Receep has been posted Aug 2025 wherein Leasing retirement also posted.
Note that asset has not been deactivated.
4. Come November 2025, we need to reverse the asset retirement since termination did not pushed through and we have to continue the contract.
5. We now performed RECEEPRV to reverse valuation postings. However we are now encountering an error:
Errors occurred for asset XXXX XXXXXXXXXX in fiscal year 2025.

We have tried removing the given notice and reversing the RECEEP but we still encountered the same error when reversing the receep postings in November 2025.
We cannot reverse in the same period used in posting asset retirement as FI posting period is already closed for Aug 2025.

How do we reverse the asset retirement from SAP RE-FX after the lease termination has been cancelled?
What is the process for this?

Regards,
Lained33

entry.title: Re: Predicting Cycling Performance: SAP RPT-1 vs AI Chat Models and Strava
entry.content:
Hi Community,

 

" The comparison highlights clear patterns:

  • Strava remains the most accurate overall, with minimal deviation in both time and speed. Its specialized algorithm and access to large datasets give it a strong advantage.
  • SAP RPT-1 stands out as a powerful alternative. It delivered deterministic predictions, handled structured data effectively, and achieved results very close to reality. This shows its potential for numeric forecasting beyond sports‚Äîthink production planning or predictive maintenance.
  • Gemini produced fast responses and understood units correctly, but its speed prediction was less precise.
  • Copilot and ChatGPT struggled with numeric interpretation. Copilot showed inconsistent outputs, while ChatGPT had the largest error in time prediction, likely due to misunderstanding units."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

 

üôÇ

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: How to customize push notification payload to send additional data from S4 to SSAM
entry.content:
Currently in the standard push notification feature for SAP Service and Asset Manager, only the object key of particular object like Notification number for Notification and Order Id for Work Order is sent to mobile device in push notification payload. Sample payload:

{"notification":{"alert":"{\"title-loc-key\":\"NOTIF_TITLE_KEY\",\"title-loc-args\": [\"1000000000\"],\"loc-key\":\"NOTIF_BODY_KEY\",\"loc-args\": [\"1000000000\"]}","data":"{\"ObjectType\":\"Notification\",\"ObjectID\":\"1000000000\"}"}

But we want to show additional details in the push notification message like notification description and technical object description. We found the exact method which generates the payload. Class /MFND/CL_CORE_OTRIG_CPMS_PUSH  and method is BUILD_JSON_DATA.

But in this method, we are only able to get Object Key (Notification Number) and no other data. Also we are not able to fetch relevant data from table as notification is not yet saved.

Does anyone knows how can we handle this situation and how to send additional data like Technical object description in this payload. Any BAdI available for this or how to achieve this?

entry.title: Re: Dynamic ALV column creates default excel column col:
entry.content:
I tried to debug, found that the excel writer class appends the 'col:' in the beginning of the dynamic column if no fieldcatalog was passed. TO avoid this, fill the field catalog like below:

data(lt_field_catalog) = zcl_excel_common=>get_fieldcatalog( ip_table = <fs_table> ).

"Loop through the catalog, fill scrtext_s,scrtext_m,scrtext_l here.

"Pass when binding table

lo_worksheet->bind_table(
  EXPORTING
    ip_table         = <fs_table>
    it_field_catalog = lt_field_catalog

The generated excel should use the text you passed to your field catalog. The class doesn't automatically use the contents of your alv field catalog. Solved.

Hope this helps someone in the future.

Thanks!

Geoff

entry.title: SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405 Work Order list Screen Search bar not working as Expected
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We‚Äôve customized the Work Order List screen in our SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2405 application for our customer, and we‚Äôre facing a search issue.

Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôve done:

We modified the WorkOrderObjectCell.fragment for the Work Order list.
In the fragment, we updated the Subhead property as follows:

"Subhead": "{{#Property:HeaderFunctionLocation}} - {{#Property:FunctionalLocation/#Property:FuncLocDesc}} - {{#Property:FunctionalLocation/#Property:Address/#Property:Name}}"

After this change, the subhead correctly displays the desired values on the UI (as shown in the attached imge.jpg).

However, when we use the search bar on the Work Order List screen, the search does not return results based on the HeaderFunctionLocation value.

For example, if we search for a value like 23651 (which is visible in the Subhead for one of the work orders), no results are shown.

What could be the issue here?

Is there any limitation or restriction beyond searching on this property?

Best Regards,

Divan Wellalage

The order of categories should be determined by the columns SequenceNumber and RSequenceNumber in table cat2prodrel. So please kindly check if these 2 values are synced for the target product:

select * from cat2prodrel where targetpk = {product pk}.

In your case, the values are mostly kept to be the same value, so the order will be random.

You can also check below related questions for more details:

entry.title: Automating Invoice Processing Using SAP BTP, CAPM, and Document Information Extraction AI
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs business world, automating repetitive back-office tasks can greatly enhance efficiency and accuracy. One such task is invoice verification and processing. In this blog, I‚Äôll share how I built an end-to-end automated invoice processing system using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model), and SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX) AI ‚Äî leveraging OCR for intelligent data extraction and reporting.

 

Business Scenario:

Many organizations receive vendor invoices via email in different formats ‚Äî PDFs, scanned images, or photos. Manually verifying and uploading these invoices into systems like SAP S/4HANA or SAP Business ByDesign can be time-consuming and error-prone.

 

My goal was to automate this entire process:

  1. Read incoming emails
  2. Validate invoice templates
  3. Extract invoice details intelligently
  4. Store structured data in JSON format
  5. Generate a daily summary report (Excel)

Architecture Overview

Tools & Services Used:

  • SAP BTP CAPM (Cloud Application Programming Model): For building backend logic and APIs
  • SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX) AI: For intelligent extraction of invoice content
  • SAP BTP Object Store / Document Repository: For storing extracted documents
  • Email Listener / Node.js service: For reading and parsing incoming emails
  • ExcelJS (or CAP plugin): For generating daily invoice reports

End-to-End Flow

  1. Email Monitoring:
    A CAP service listens to a configured mailbox using IMAP or MS Graph API. When a new mail arrives, it checks the subject and body for invoice-related keywords.
  2. Template Validation:
    The email content is validated against a predefined invoice template format to ensure that only legitimate invoices proceed further.
  3. Attachment Check:
    If an attachment exists:
    • If it‚Äôs a PDF, it‚Äôs sent directly to Document Extraction AI.
    • If it‚Äôs an image (JPEG, PNG, etc.), it‚Äôs first converted to PDF using an OCR library (like PDFKit), and then sent to DOX AI.
  4. Document Information Extraction:
    The Document Extraction AI service processes the document and extracts key invoice fields like:
    • Vendor Name
    • Invoice Number
    • Invoice Date
    • Total Amount
    • Tax Details

The extracted content is then stored as a JSON object in an SAP HANA database (or another data persistence layer in CAP).

  1. Data Storage and Reporting:
    At the end of the day, the system aggregates all processed invoices and generates a daily Excel report summarizing:
    • Number of invoices processed
    • Success vs. failure count
    • Vendor-wise totals
    • Any anomalies or mismatches

This report is made available for download or automatically emailed to the finance team.

 

Technical Highlights

  • CAPM Backend Logic:
    Built a CAP service that handles mail events, document extraction calls, and report generation.
  • Integration with DOX AI:
    Used the Document Information Extraction API from SAP AI Business Services for content parsing.
    API endpoint example:
  • POST /document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs
  • OCR Enhancement:
    For image attachments, OCR ensures that even scanned documents are converted into machine-readable text before extraction.
  • JSON Storage:
    Extracted content is saved in a structured JSON format in the CAP model, making it easy to query, audit, or feed into analytics dashboards.
  • Excel Generation:
    Used Node.js-based Excel generation via libraries like exceljs to automate daily reporting.

Results & Benefits

Feature

Benefit

Automated Email Monitoring

Eliminates manual mail checking

OCR + DOX Integration

Handles multiple file types (PDF/Image)

JSON Storage

Enables structured and reusable data

Excel Reporting

Provides end-of-day insights for finance teams

SAP BTP-based

Scalable, secure, and easy to extend

Final report

 

Possible Enhancements

  • Integrate with SAP Workflow Management for approvals
  • Add error notification service for failed invoices
  • Use SAP Build Apps for a visual dashboard of daily processing
  • Enable multi-language OCR for international invoice formats

entry.title: How to use G/L a/c tolerance group in SAP public cloud
entry.content:
Hi experts, 

I am testing the operations of G/L account tolerance group in SAP public cloud, but the differences within the tolerance limit were not automatically written off as expected. I suppose there was something wrong with how I ran the operations. Please kindly tell me out. 

The following is how I ran the test and the detailed problem. 

Step 1: Define Tolerance Groups for G/L Accounts

In CBC app: "Define Tolerance Groups for G/L Accounts" (SSCUI: 102323), I defined a G/L a/c tolerance group 10JP for a company code. 

Step 2: Assign the tolerance group to a G/L a/c 

In app "Manage G/L Account Master Data", copy the existing account 1256200 (Deferred Income) into a new a/c : 12562002 with the tolerance group (defined in step 1) and OIM. 

Step 3: Post journal entries

I chose the following conceptual transactions to test

„ÉªPost an outstanding expenses transaction then make payment on it with a difference within tolerance limit

StepDocument typeDebit„ÄÄCredit„ÄÄ
3.1SA/KRSalary10000Deferred expenses10000
3.2SA/KZDeferred expenses10000Cash/bank account9900

Why don't I simply create an invoice and make payment on payables account?

The answer is that you cannot assign a G/L a/c tolerance group to a vendor reconciliation account. In SAP public cloud, each account group has pre-defined and non-editable field status, accordingly the account group of AR/AP reconciliation accounts has the field "tolerance group" suppressed. Check them in CBC app "Define Account Group" (SSCUI 103508).

3.1 Post an outstanding expenses transaction

In app "Manage Journal Entries" post the following journal entry 

3.2 Make a payment and clear open items 

Use app "Clear G/L Accounts", choose the open item created in step 3.1 and post payment to clear.

In tab "Post to G/L account", enter the account and amount for credit, using 10010000 (petty cash) and leaving 100 JPY difference.

When pressing "Simulate", the following error happens whereas the difference is within tolerance limit.

entry.title: SAP EWM - Repacking HU into Allowed Handling Unit Types in Replenishment
entry.content:
Business Scenario: High Rack can store different Handling unit types such as A1, A2, A3 and B1. Stock will be Replenished to Fix bins; however, Fix bins can store only HUs with B1 Handling unit type. Before pushing stock to fixed bins HUs with same HU type as B1 should directly move to fix bins and HU type other than B1 need to repack in a WorkCentre.   

Configuration:

1) Define Handling Unit Types

SPRO > Integration with Other SAP Components >Extended Warehouse Management > Additional Material Attributes >Attribute Values for Additional Material Master Fields >Define Handling Unit Type

2) Define HU Type Groups and Assign HU Types

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Handling Units > Define HU Type Groups

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Handling Units > Define HU Types for Each Warehouse Number and Assign HU Type Group

3) Define Storage Types

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Master Data> Define Storage Types

a) High Rack Storage

b) Work Center Storage 

c) Fix Bin Storage

4) Define Activity Area

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Master Data> Activity Areas > Define Sort Sequence for Activity Areas

5) Define POSC

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Warehouse Task > Define Process-Oriented Storage Control

Storage Process ‚Äì Definition

Assign Storage Process steps

Process-Oriented Storage Control

- IB03 step is maintained here to move products from Workcenter which will be repacked in OB02 step. In OB02 only HU Types maintained under PALL HU type group will be repacked. 

6)  Define Work Center

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Master Data> Work Center > Define Work Center

7) Define Warehouse Order Creation rule

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Warehouse Order > Define Limit Values for the Size of a Warehouse Order

Field Activity area used to limit the creation of warehouse order where products of different HU types are stored in High Rack

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Warehouse Order > Define Packing Profile for Warehouse Order Creation

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Cross-Process Settings > Warehouse Order > Define Creation Rules for Warehouse Orders

       

Define Search Sequence of Creation Rules for Activity Areas

8)Picking Strategies

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Goods Issue Process > Strategies > Specify Storage Type Search Sequence

Determine Storage Type Search Sequence for Stock Removal

9) Activate Replenishment

SPRO > SCM EWM > EWM > Internal Warehouse Processes > Replenishment Control > Activate Replenishment Strategies in Storage Types

Master Data: 

1) Create material Master

a) Materials

b) Packaging materials

2) Packaging specification

3) Additional Attributes for activity area /N/SCWM/SEBA

4) Assign Fixed Bins /N/SCWM/BINMAT

5) Create Bins and Assign Storage Section

6)  Load Storage bin sorting /N/SCWM/SRTUP

Testing:

1) Replenish Stock /N/SCWM/REPL

Enter Mandatory parameters such as warehouse number and PED and execute.

Select line item to Replenish and click on execute

We can observe WT are created for Fix bins.

2) Confirm Warehouse Order

Products stored in AA CART with HU type B1 packaging are grouped in WO02 warehouse order. Whereas Products stored in AA PALL with HU types A1, A2 and A3 packaging are grouped in WO01 warehouse order and this help us to direct products with other HU type to repack into Pick HU of Hu type B1 using packaging specification.  

We can observe Multiple Pick HUs are created with HU type B1.

Click on Confirm in Foreground, Pick HU will be updated as Destination HU while Source Hu is still blank, hence user can scan/pick any available Handling unit to confirm WT/WO. Here 1st step OB01 is completed.

We can observe here once the order is confirmed, Destination bin is updated in WO as workcenter bin.

Confirm other order

                                         

For Warehouse order WO02, destination is Fix bin as no repacking needed.

3) Pack Products in Workcenter /N/SCWM/PACK

As control for picking HU is 3 Only adopt content (mat. + lower-level HUs) into pick HU at warehouse process type, qty moved directly into pick HU. We can select Pick HU and print them in workcenter. Once all the activities completed, click on Complete process step for HU.

New WT will be created on refresh to move repacked HUs to fix bins 

Step IB03 to move products to fix bin storage with HU type B1. Products will automatically pick their destination bin from Fix bin assignment (/SCWM/BINMAT).

entry.title: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple OData Services in BAS
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

I would like to ask a question regarding how to manage Destinations on SAP BTP.

So far, we have been using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service to create Destinations for each individual communication scenario (e.g., one for sales order integration, another for purchase order integration).
As a result, we are ending up with multiple Destinations‚Äîone per communication scenario‚Äîthat correspond to each OData service we wish to use.

On the other hand, when connecting BTP with an SAP on-premise system, it has been possible to access various OData services through a single Destination.

Our current objective is to enable a development flow where we can build a Fiori application in BAS and, at the initial data source selection step, choose from various OData services (e.g., purchase, sales, or custom OData) via a single Destination.

However, as it stands, only the OData services associated with the specific communication scenario used when the Destination was created are selectable during BAS development. This limits flexibility in application development.

Is there any recommended configuration or best practice that would allow us to create a single Destination that can be used to access multiple communication scenarios or OData services?

I would greatly appreciate your guidance on this matter.

Thanks,

entry.title: What's new in SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
SAP Logistics Management is our new solution in Supply Chain Management that combines warehousing‚ÄØand transportation management‚ÄØto streamline your operations‚ÄØwith network-centric collaboration. As mentioned in the previous What's new article, we are committed to delivering innovations continuously on a bi-weekly basis. 

In this blog post, you will learn about the new features in SAP Logistics Management that have been released this week. 

 

Print loading list

You can now print the loading list for a pickup in the Manage Pickups and Deliveries app. The loading list contains general information like carrier and ship-to party. Depending on when you print the loading list, it shows the goods that are planned to be loaded onto the truck or are already loaded.

Exemplary loading list: 

 

Upload stock

In the setup section, you may find a new app where you can upload a spreadsheet file containing stock data to be posted into the system. You can perform the following actions: 

  • Download a spreadsheet template file to define the initial stock
  • Import the initial stock by uploading the spreadsheet file
  • Validate the data errors in the uploaded data before posting the stock
  • Post stock into specified storage bins

 

Sites in organizational model

With this feature, you can import sites in your organizational models via the Import Organizational Model app. A site acts as a higher-level organizational unit including shipping points and warehouses.

 

Confirm warehouse tasks with changes

With this feature, you can confirm warehouse tasks with changes, for example, the change of confirmed quantities and destination storage bins. You can also filter warehouse tasks using these changes in the Process Warehouse Tasks app. Currently, you can change confirmed quantities for ad-hoc and putaway warehouse tasks.

When you confirm putaway warehouse tasks by navigating from the Manage Inbound Warehouse Activities app, you can also reduce the confirmed quantity and put away less quantity than the planned quantity.

 

Create ad hoc warehouse tasks for stock with a reference to an outbound warehouse request

With this feature, you can create ad hoc warehouse tasks in the Manage Stock app for stock that has already been reserved for an outbound warehouse request. This allows you to move already picked stock. 

 

Related documents for inbound warehouse requests

With this feature, you can view related documents for inbound warehouse requests in the Manage Inbound Warehouse Activities app.

 

Integration card for inbound warehouse request

With this feature, when you access SAP Logistics Management via SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, you can see an integration card showing the progress of inbound warehouse requests in each status after choosing a single date or a date range.

More information about integration cards in SAP Build Work Zone can be found here. 

 

New attributes for carrier determination

Two new logistics attributes have been introduced to determine the appropriate carrier via the processing rule for a transportation request or a consignment order. They are: 

  • Total Gross Weight
  • Total Gross Weight Unit 

The carrier determination can be found in the Define Processing Rules app. 

 

Usability improvements for consignments and transportation requests

In the Manage Transportation Requests app you can now use a filter to search for errors and open tasks more easily: 

In the Manage Consignments app, the tag "BN4L" is displayed when a carrier is set up for use in SAP Business Network Freight Collaboration. 

In the Manage Transportation Requests app, the popover for the warehouse processing status in the progress overview explains why a delivery isn't ready for warehouse processing yet.

 

All these features have been deployed this week and are available in the SAP Logistics Management tenants. We are happy to hear your feedback about the latest enhancements. Going forward you may find any information about new features also in our What's New Viewer. 

 

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management Product Page

entry.title: Handling Index creation failure in SUM phase EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_RUN
entry.content:
During an upgrade using the Software Update Manager (SUM) with the Database Migration Option (DMO) option, errors may occur in the phase EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_RUN with below error

***************************************************************************************************************************

A3WEIMP 047 PRIMARY KEY  (  "MANDT" ,  "E_FINIS" ,  "EPN_PREFIX" ,  "EPN_BASE" ,  "EPN_SUFFIX" ,  "LOC_CODE" ,  "CREATED_ON" ,  "CREATED_TIME"  )'

A3WEIMP 047 (HDB) dbrc = 26 'unique constraint violated'

A3WEIMP 047 (HDB) SQL error = 349

A3WEIMP 047 (HDB) cannot CREATE UNIQUE INDEX; duplicate key found:  [5] Several documents with the same ID exist in the index;SAPHANADB:/ <NAMESPACE>//BDL_NPSA.$trexexternalkey$ content not unique, cannot define unique constraint. rowCount != distinctCount

A3WEIMP 047 (HDB) DBCreate failed

A2EEIMP 049 Index creation failed before - listing duplicate records for '/<NAMESPACE>/BDL_NPSA~0' with key fields: MANDT E_FINIS EPN_PREFIX EPN_BASE EPN_SUFFIX LOC_CODE CREATED_ON CREATED_TIME

A4EEIMP 051 Duplicate record with key: '120' '1001713' '95VW' '5B489' 'AB' 'DE' '20230822' '000100' (occurs 3 times).

A3EEIMP 052 Found 1 duplicate keys in 3 records.

A1EEIMP 008 Task failed with error: (HDB) DbSlExecute failed for DDL statement 'ALTER TABLE "/<NAMESPACE>//BDL_NPSA"

A1EEIMP 008 ADD CONSTRAINT "/<NAMESPACE>/BDL_NPSA~0"

A1EEIMP 008 PRIMARY KEY  (  "MANDT" ,  "E_FINIS" ,  "EPN_PREFIX" ,  "EPN_BASE" ,  "EPN_SUFFIX" ,  "LOC_CODE" ,  "CREATED_ON" ,  "CREATED_TIME"  )'

A1EEIMP 008 (HDB) dbrc = 26 'unique constraint violated'

A1EEIMP 008 (HDB) SQL error = 349

A1EEIMP 008 (HDB) cannot CREATE UNIQUE INDEX; duplicate key found:  [5] Several documents with the same ID exist in the index;SAPHANADB:/FORDEU/BDL_NPSA.$trexexternalkey$ content not unique, cannot define unique constraint. rowCount != distinctCount

A1EEIMP 008 (HDB) DBCreate failed

A2EETSK 007 Finished create for object "/<NAMESPACE>/BDL_NPSA~0" of type "primary index" with error in 0.190 sec #20250922081128

 

***************************************************************************************************************************

The error indicates that there are duplicate entries in the table of target DB. This is causing the creation of a unique index to fail, as there are multiple records with the same key. The duplicate entries come from the source DB as shown below:

 

Source Database

Target  Database Table

To fix/mitigate the issue, following actions can be taken:

Case 1: Duplicate entries can be deleted

Identify the duplicate entries in the source database and delete them from the source database.

If it is HANA database, please use the HANA scripts HANA_Data_DuplicateKeys_CommandGenerator_1.00.100+ and HANA_Data_DuplicateKeys_columnStore_Deletion_CommandGenerator attached in SAP Note 1969700.

Once the entries are deleted, retry the step in SUM tool.

 

Case 2: If customer is not allowing to delete the duplicate entries from Source database.

Ignore the index creation in Target DB with below steps:

Identify the MIGRATE_DT_REPAIR_IMP.TSK file under ../SUM/abap/load/migrate_dt_repair directory.

Edit the index entry (which is having the issue) in the file as below:

P <Index name > C ign

 

With this, SUM process will skip the index creation for this table.

Repeat the SUM phase again.

Note: If the index is required later, it can be created manually after the target system is available.

entry.title: Configuration settings for automatic PS Project creation from PPM Item
entry.content:
Introduction:

In this Blog Post we will explore key topics such as item types, utilizing PS Projects as templates, activating Project System integration, maintaining synchronization scenarios, and establishing object links. Additionally, we will highlight important configuration settings within the Project System that ensure a seamless transition from PPM to PS Projects. By understanding these configurations, project managers / consultants / users can streamline their processes, reduce manual errors.

 SAP PPM Configuration Objects Covered:

  • Item Types
  • PS Project as Template
  • Activation of Project System integration
  • Maintenance of Synchronization scenarios
  • Settings for Object Links
  • Key Important setting in Project System

 Settings for Automatic creation of PS Project from PPM Item:

To automatically create a PS Project from a PPM Item, you need to configure the Item Type where the ‚ÄúLink to Project System‚Äù column is set to ‚ÄúPS Project System.‚Äù

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Global Customizing ‚Äì Portfolio-Independent Settings ‚Äì Define Portfolio Item Types

You must have assigned SAP Project System Operative Project Object Number (Without ‚ÄúPD‚Äù as prefix) as Template at below mentioned configuration Node.

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Global Customizing ‚Äì Portfolio-Independent Settings ‚Äì Map Item Type to Project or PS or Commercial Project

Select ‚ÄúItem Type to PS Project‚Äù and maintain the number in ‚ÄúProject ID‚Äù column.

Note: This task must be performed by opening the client, such as Test or Production, where you need to maintain the template.

The Operative PS Project used here as template is ‚ÄúCHEM-25-001‚Äù with Object ID Number (OBJNR) PD00000048:

Project Structure:

Activation of Project System integration:

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio Management ‚Äì Base System Interfaces ‚Äì Portfolio-Management-Specific Settings for Project Management Systems Integ ‚Äì Enable Project Management Systems Integration

Maintenance of Synchronization scenarios:

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Common Functions ‚Äì Decision Flow Management Settings ‚Äì Attribute Synchronization ‚Äì Maintain Attributes for Synchronization Scenarios

The attributes highlighted below must be maintained for the creation and updating of a PS Project from a PPM Item:

Note: You can explore the remaining attributes if you wish to update the PPM Item Decision Point or the Item from the PS WBS, among other options, based on various business requirements.

Settings for Object Links:

The configurations mentioned above are essential for the automatic creation of a PS Project from a PPM Item along with other very important configurations in PPM, as outlined below, where you need to define the Logical System, Destination, and Web Servers for each relevant object type.

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Common Functions ‚Äì Decision Flow Management Settings ‚Äì Define DFM Object Link Types

Note: It is recommended to perform this configuration in the appropriate system by opening the client, such as the Test or Production system. Otherwise, the TR movement may override the settings.

Same way update for all the relevant Object Types, like PS Project Definition etc.

And

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio Management ‚Äì Base System Interfaces ‚Äì Application Object Settings ‚Äì Define Object Link Types

Note: It is recommended to perform this configuration in the appropriate system by opening the client, such as the Test or Production system. Otherwise, the TR movement may override the settings.

Same way update for all the relevant Object Types.

Now let‚Äôs execute the scenario:

Item created with ID TESTDEMO001:

Now, create the project by selecting the checkbox. Here, we can see that the PS Project we assigned as a template in the configuration is available for selection to establish the PS Project structure.

Clicking on Save will automatically create the PS Project. After the project is created, the PS Project option will now be available in the Item.

In the Relationship tab under Related Objects, we can observe that the PS Project has been automatically assigned.

In Project Builder - CJ20N also we can see the PS Project is created:

Note: One very important configuration needs to be considered in terms of automatic creation of PS project from PPM Item, The Edit checkbox in ‚ÄúSpecial Characters in Project Number‚Äù should not be checked: -

Transaction Code: OPSK

Configuration Node: Project System ‚Äì Structures ‚Äì Operative Structures ‚Äì Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) ‚Äì Project Coding Mask ‚Äì Define Special Characters for Projects

If this checkbox is selected, the system will encounter issues when creating a PS Project due to restrictions of coded projects.

Conclusion:

By carefully following the configuration settings mentioned in this article, you will be able to achieve the error free automatic PS Project creation from PPM Item.

SAP Portfolio and Project Management SAP Portfolio and Project Management for SAP S/4HANA PLM Project System (PS)

entry.title: IntelliFlow Manufacturing with SAP S/4HANA UX and Collaboration Manager
entry.content:
In the ever-changing field of digital manufacturing, SAP continues to push the boundaries of innovation with its new release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Among the noteworthy features is the Review Progress Order‚ÄîMultilevel View App, a game-changing tool for improving visibility, control, and cooperation across production and procurement processes. This strong pair, together with the newly released SAP Collaboration Manager, is redefining real-time communication and job execution for industrial teams.

Introducing the Review Progress Order app.
Manufacturing procedures are complicated, with many levels of connections, components, and timelines. The Review Progress Order App handles this complexity by providing a multi-level view of production, sales, and processing orders.

It allows users to

  •   Visualize component needs and receipt aspects throughout an order structure.
    ‚Ä¢ Identify and analyze component shortages and delays to determine their root causes.
    ‚Ä¢ Calculate total order delays depending on delivery and production time.
    ‚Ä¢ Easily access associated apps, such as Manage Material Coverage, Display Material Stock, and Change Planned Order.
    ‚Ä¢ Export data to Excel for offline analysis and reporting.

Why It Matters
Manufacturers frequently suffer with fragmented data and delayed insights. The Review Progress Order App combines crucial information into a single, simple interface. It enables planners and production managers to make educated decisions more rapidly, minimizing bottlenecks and boosting on-time delivery performance.
Collaboration Manager: A New Era of In-App Communication.
SAP has officially decommissioned the SAP CoPilot and introduced the SAP Collaboration Manager as a replacement for human-to-human collaboration within the SAP Fiori Launchpad. This innovation is currently available in both SAP S/4HANA Cloud and on-premise editions, providing a contextual, real-time communication layer directly within business applications

Key Features of Collaboration Manager:
‚Ä¢ Set up individual or group discussions based on specific screens or business objects.
‚Ä¢ Include attachments, screenshots, and video links in chats.
‚Ä¢ Edit or remove messages quickly after posting.
‚Ä¢ Convert private notes into collaborative threads as needed.
‚Ä¢ Go straight to the screenshot or chat screen.
‚Ä¢ Receive quick notifications for prompt answers and task completion
Collaboration in the Manufacturing Context

Let's see a demo to understand it more clearly. 

To set the context, let's assume a sales representative has received a call from a customer about the delay of their order. The sales representative then contacts the production team to inquire about the delay.  Assume a production planner uses the Review Progress Order App to detect a delay in a vital component. Rather than switching systems or exchanging emails, users may start a discussion with the procurement team right away using Collaboration Manager. The discussion contains screenshots, order information, and direct links to the affected components. This in-house collaboration eliminates delays, improves clarity, and speeds up problem solving.

Here in the demo, one of the customers contacted the sales representative, Dale Jones, who was asking for confirmation on the delayed sales order delivery. The sales representative sent a message through Collaboration Manager to the material planner or production planner regarding this matter. Here, the material planner, Michelle, replied with "acknowledge the message" by clicking on the sent icon to the sales representative through the Collaboration Manager.


Fig 1 : In App communication - Collaboration Manager

 

Fig 2 : Collaboration Manager - Acknowledgement

Then Michelle clicks on the "Review Order Progress" app in the Favorites section. After providing the sales order number in the app, she finds the Issues column and finds two issues are present‚Äîone of the required components has an uncovered quantity of 3 pieces for a planned product order. In this case, ‚ÄúPldOrd 4000002986.‚Äù The other one has a total delay of 1 day for the 10 pieces coming via a purchase requisition. In this case, ‚ÄúPurRqs 3000002513-10.‚Äù

Fig 3 : Review Progress Order app

 

Fig 4: in app option to navigate

The app, "Manage Material Coverage" option‚ÄîManage the material coverage to resolve this issue. The "Reschedule" option for the Purchase Requisition provides a summary of the material coverage for this component, indicating that we are short by 10 pieces and need them within 9 days. The stock/requirements list provides an overview of what is coming in and going out when: Aug 12th I need 10 pieces, but I will be 10 short then.


Fig 5: Resolving issue

The system automatically proposes the new delivery date. It is now up to the user to accept it or reject it for an earlier or later date.

Fig 6 : Issue shown

Here, the coverage issue for the material can be viewed.

Fig 7: In house navigation

 

Fig 8: Resolving issue via Manage Monitor Coverage

 

Fig 9: Issue Resolve

All the issues are now resolved.
The Review Order Progress application makes it easy to obtain an overview of any issues an order may have and also makes it easy to resolve them.

Fig 10: Collaboration Manager - communication

 

Customer Benefits: Synergy of UX and Intelligence
The combination of the Review Progress Order App and Collaboration Manager provides a comprehensive user experience that combines data transparency and real-time collaboration. This is how customers benefit:
1. Improved Decision-Making
With multilayer visibility of order progress and component delays, users can solve issues before they escalate. The ability to export data and navigate to connected apps ensures that decisions are based on thorough information.
2. Improved operational efficiency.
Collaboration Manager improves workflow efficiency by eliminating the need for external communication tools and enabling contextual discussions. Teams spend less time searching for information and more time carrying out tasks.
3. Faster issue resolution.
Real-time notifications and interactive threads help cross-functional teams address problems rapidly. The system immediately notifies the appropriate persons of any shortage, delay, or procurement problem.
4. User-Centric Design.
Both tools are based on SAP Fiori, which ensures a uniform and straightforward user experience. The interface is dynamic, role-based, and geared for productivity, whether used on a desktop or a mobile device.
5. Scalability & Integration
These elements are part of SAP's overall vision for building an intelligent, sustainable organization. They readily interact with other SAP apps and modules, allowing for scalability across sectors and geographies.

Conclusion: A New Standard for Manufacturing Excellence.
SAP's most recent developments in S/4HANA are more than just feature enhancements; they represent a paradigm shift in how industrial firms function. The Review Progress Order App clarifies complex order structures, and the Collaboration Manager encourages agile, informed teamwork.
They represent a strong blend of UX and enterprise intelligence, allowing businesses to respond faster, collaborate smarter, and provide better results. For consumers, their use implies more production, lower costs, and higher satisfaction‚Äîall hallmarks of a really intelligent manufacturing organization.

entry.title: Re: Cannot find an easier way to do conditional aggregati...
entry.content:
@quincycheng1992 

I think you have done it correctly using multiple measures. 2 for Boolean evaluation, 2 for aggregation of these Booleans and finally the division. The default SAC behavior is Aggregation first, calculation next. But If you see you calculate first and aggregate next  and then calculate again given the nature of your calculation. Another thing is SAC separates different type of calculation namely Calculated, Restricted and Aggregation. SAC is more like Lego approach where you build the parts first and finally tie them together hence multiple kinds of measures. I agree to you that at times ( mostly) this is inefficient primarily due to increase in count of measures. Other BI tools allow you to merge different behavior in a single calculation as they do not differentiate between calculation/restriction and aggregation. Lets put it this way this differentiation of calculation is something flowing from historical SAP BI/BW tools.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

What: We will be upgrading from OpenSearch 1.3 to 2.19. This upgrade brings:

¬∑ Security & compliance hardenings

¬∑ Performance & stability improvements, including improved query performance, memory efficiency, and index handling

¬∑ Powerful new features including Index management improvements, Enhanced anomaly detection, Better integration with SAML, OIDC (which we will enable shortly after validation), Improved Alerting, Shrink API, Support for additional SQL/DSL queries

When: The upgrade will happen in 3 phases

¬∑ Phase 1 "Prepare" (anytime): Prepare for the consumption of the upgrade by analyzing the adaptation guide

¬∑ Phase 2 "Explore" (starting July 10üòû Opt-in to the upgrade version via feature flag for creating new or updating existing Cloud Logging instances to OpenSearch 2.19. Use this phase to validate integrations, explore features, verify custom dashboards & provide feedback, or to prepone the productive usage of OpenSearch 2.19.

¬∑ Phase 3 "Adopt" (starting November 27üòû All Cloud Logging instances will be force-upgraded to the new OpenSearch version 2.19


Configuration Parameters | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Financial Execution & Claims for Trade Promotions with SAP Revenue Growth Management & SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
1. Bridging the Gap Between Promotion Planning and Financial Accuracy 

Imagine you are a Key Account Manager (KAM) at a leading beverage manufacturer working with a large retail chain. You design various trade promotions (e.g., discounts, displays, rebates) to boost sales and market presence.  

Yet, managing associated trade spends, reconciling retailer claims, and ensuring precise financial settlements can be an operational headache for finance controllers, who play a critical role in overseeing and validating all financial postings related to trade spend, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and accountability throughout the process. Supporting this effort is the Order-to-Cash (O2C) specialist, responsible for managing the end-to-end order process, including order fulfillment, invoicing, and handling claims or disputes related to trade promotions. 

Manual reconciliation, delayed financial clarity, and disconnected systems often hinder teams from accurately measuring promotion effectiveness and revenue impact, ultimately slowing the growth that KAMs and consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies depend on. 

This is where our solution steps in, with its Financial Execution and Claims for Trade Promotion capabilities that seamlessly bridge trade promotion planning and financial execution with the SAP S/4HANA ecosystem. By connecting promotions planned in SAP Revenue Growth Management directly to financial execution in S/4HANA and then to claims management, we offer a fully automated end-to-end solution for financial posting. 

 

2. A Suite Designed to Integrate and Simplify Trade Spend Execution: SAP Revenue Growth Management 

SAP Revenue Growth Management (REVENUE GROWTH MANAGEMENT) serves as a central platform enabling CPG companies to create, plan, and monitor promotions with built-in integration into SAP S/4HANA‚Äôs finance and sales modules. Trade promotion tactics such as discounts, rebates, and display funding are transformed into condition contracts and condition records for pricing within SAP S/4HANA, becoming the foundation for financial execution. 

The execution phase uses these contracts and condition records for pricing during invoicing, ensuring promotions reflect correctly in accounting. Following execution, claims are submitted by retailers for reimbursements or deductions in many different forms and methods. Once these documents and back-up materials are obtained, the claims are matched against the condition contracts. Approved claims trigger settlements, creating credit memos or adjustments that close the loop for accurate revenue recognition.  

This end-to-end integration reduces manual work, prevents errors like overpayments, and offers finance teams full visibility into promotional trade spend obligations. It also empowers KAMs to achieve measurable revenue growth‚Äîall operating out-of-the-box within the SAP Business Suite. 

Target integration landscape for financial execution and settlement of trade promotions  

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

 

3. Key Functionalities of Financial Execution and Claims in SAP Revenue Growth Management 

3.1. Variable Discounts Explained   

Variable discounts, also known as OI discounts (can be called either on-invoice or off-invoice depending on the region), are discounts directly applied to the invoice. They happen only during the sell-in process. 

  • Effective Pricing Strategy Enablement

Variable discounts provide KAMs with the agility to implement pricing tactics such as a percentage off the list price or fixed amounts directly on sales invoices. This capability supports strategic selling, such as volume discounts or targeted discounts (e.g., for specific channels, customers, or timing), driving retailer engagement without cumbersome manual interventions.  

  • Direct Invoice Application

Since variable discounts apply at invoice generation (sell-in phase), financial postings are immediate and precise. This direct connection between promotions and invoicing simplifies reconciliation and reduces disputes from the start. 

The precision enabled by variable discounts not only ensures timely and precise financial postings but also guarantees that retailers receive precise invoices, leading to improved retailer satisfaction and stronger business partnerships. 

Trade spend scenarios

3.2. Comprehensive Variable and Fixed Rebates Management  

  • Accrual-Based Rebate Handling

SAP Revenue Growth Management allows setting aside accruals for both variable and fixed rebates. This ensures liabilities are reserved accurately in financial accounts, streamlining budget control.  

  • Variable rebates, also known as bill backs or retroactive rebates in the US, are rebates that vary based on sales or shipment volumes. Variable rebates can apply to all segments of the distribution chain, including sell-in, sell-through, and sell-out. 
  • Fixed rebates, also known as lump sums, such as display fees or feature costs, do not depend on product movements within the distribution chain but remain constant over a promotional period. 

 

  • Support for Rebate Payment Processes

SAP Revenue Growth Management facilitates various payment methods, such as credit memos against accounts receivable, and plans to support accounts payable processes for retailer invoice claims in 2026. This versatility aligns with varying corporate accounting practices and enhances transparency and efficiency in managing trade spend. 

Proper accrual management ensures rebate liabilities are consistently and correctly recognized in financial accounts, enabling compliant and timely accounting postings. This approach builds confidence and efficiency within finance teams, supports KAMs by providing transparent visibility into trade spend, and facilitates appropriate sales revenue recognition. 

 

3.3. End-to-End Claims Management and Settlement 

  • Unified Claim Request Management

All trade-related claims from retailers ‚Äî whether deduction claims due to short pays or invoice claims requesting reimbursement ‚Äî are consolidated within RGM Claims Management. This provides a single source of truth with full visibility into claims status, approval workflows, and linkage to financial postings and settlements. 

  • Validation and Workflow

The system supports claim matching to corresponding promotions, with validation rules that reduce manual errors and allow multiple analysts to perform different validations in parallel, enhancing operational efficiency in complex accounts. 

  • Settlement and Financial Transparency (planned for 2026)

Settlement functionality, integrated with SAP S/4HANA condition contracts, will automate the creation of settlement and accounting documents, ensuring accurate financial execution. This upcoming capability will enhance audit compliance and provide clearer visibility into trade spend. 

Ultimately, these capabilities help KAMs and CPG companies deliver smoother processes and have more satisfied retail customers. 

 

4. Co-Innovation: Advancing Financial Execution and Claims Management 

With the Financial Execution and Claims capabilities of SAP Revenue Growth Management, CPG companies benefit from an integrated, fully automated end-to-end financial posting process that links key functions such as variable discounts, variable and fixed rebate management, and unified claims handling.  

This seamless integration facilitates timely financial postings and enhances visibility into trade spending, empowering finance controllers and KAMs throughout the trade promotion lifecycle.  

If you're a finance controller, O2C specialist, or a KAM eager to innovate how promotions translate into accurate financial outcomes and tangible business results, contact us today at RGM_Engage@sap.com to join our co-innovation program. Together, let's shape financial execution and claims with SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

 

More Information

Documentation on SAP Help Portal

Topic Page for SAP Revenue Growth Management

  • Unlocking Trade Spend Control Efficiency with Funds Management in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Decoding Promotional Success: Embedded Analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Introducing Calendar View in SAP Revenue Growth Management: A Visual Leap for Strategic Planning
  • Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs Account Plan
  • Elevate Your Promotion Strategy: Baseline Management with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
  • Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
  • Financial Execution and Claims for Trade Promotions with SAP Revenue Growth Management and SAP Cloud ERP
